Japanese: 私のこと待っててくれてもよかったのに
English: You could have waited for me.

Japanese: もう少しで諦めるところだった
English: I was about to give up.

Japanese: 将来スポーツができなくなる
English: I might not be able to play sports in the future.

Japanese: 〇〇が間違いなわけないね
English: 〇〇 can’t go wrong.

Japanese: 外出する気分じゃないいな
English: I don't feel like going out.

Japanese: もしうまくいかなかったらどうする？
English: What if it doesn't work?

Japanese: バスを逃しそうだった
English: I almost missed the bus.

Japanese: 脚どうしたの！？
English: What happened to your leg?

Japanese: 当時料理にハマっていた
English: I was into cooking at that time.

Japanese: もう寝る時間だ
English: It's time to go to bed.

Japanese: 面接に合格するのに苦労したよ
English: I struggled to pass the job interview.

Japanese: 早めに出発した方がいいかも
English: You might wanna leave early.

Japanese: ずっとやってみたかった
English: I've always wanted to try it.

Japanese: 私たちは一度電話で話したことがある
English: We've talked on the phone once.

Japanese: ここから最も近い食料品店はどこ？
English: Where is the nearest grocery store?

Japanese: 早起きにはもう慣れた
English: I've gotten used to getting up early.

Japanese: 今は洋画を見ることに夢中です
English: I'm crazy about watching English movies.

Japanese: 完全に無料です
English: It's totally free.

Japanese: むしろここで住みたい
English: I'd rather live here.

Japanese: ルームシェアでもマンションでも大丈夫
English: Whether it's a shared house or a condo, it's fine.

Japanese: ドアを閉めていただけませんか？
English: Would you mind closing the door?

Japanese: ドアを閉めてもいいですか？
English: Do you mind if I close the door?

Japanese: 面接は思っていたより簡単だった
English: The interview was easier than I expected.

Japanese: 〇〇を探してる（口語）
English: I'm after 〇〇.

Japanese: もっと英語力があれば仕事取れたかも
English: I could have gotten the job if I were able to speak English.

Japanese: パーティーのことはどうなってる？
English: What happened to the party?

Japanese: ちょっと緊張してる
English: I'm kind of nervous.

Japanese: 英語が話せるようになるためには、
English: To get good at English,

Japanese: 面接に落ちるのはもううんざり
English: I'm tired of failing the interview.

Japanese: ランチでもしながら話そう
English: Let's talk about it over lunch.

Japanese: ダイエットしようと思ってるよ
English: I'm thinking of going on a diet.

Japanese: 今それを言っても仕方がない
English: It doesn't help saying that now.

Japanese: 締め切りに間に合えば大丈夫
English: As long as it's finished within the deadline, it's fine.

Japanese: 一回聞いたことある気がする
English: I feel like I've heard it before.

Japanese: 短髪に合いそう
English: You would look good with short hair.

Japanese: 甘いものは食べずには居られない
English: I can't help eating sweets.

Japanese: 現金持ってたりしない？
English: Do you happen to have any cash?

Japanese: もっとお金があれば、もっと旅行しただろうなぁ
English: I would have traveled more if I had had more money.

Japanese: この部屋についてどう思いますか
English: What do you think of this room?

Japanese: 彼を待った方がいいんじゃないかなぁ
English: I'd say we should wait for him.

Japanese: もっと英語を話す練習をするべきだった
English: I should have practiced speaking English more.

Japanese: iPhone置き忘れてきたかも
English: I might have left my iPhone.

Japanese: ゲームにハマってる
English: I'm addicted to the video game.

Japanese: 部屋探しがうまく行っていない
English: I'm having trouble finding a place to live.

Japanese: 心配せずにはいられない
English: I can't help worrying.

Japanese: 待つのは大丈夫ですよ
English: I don't mind waiting.

Japanese: ごめん間に合うかどうかわからない
English: Sorry, I'm not sure if I can make it.

Japanese: 締切まで後3日ってまじ？
English: I can't believe there are only 3 days left until the deadline.

Japanese: 昨日の晩何があったか聞いたか知らないけど
English: I don't know if you have heard what happened last night.

Japanese: 忘れずに明日持ってきてね
English: Make sure to bring it tomorrow

Japanese: 彼来るんかな?
English: I wonder if he's coming.

Japanese: 同僚にやらせます
English: I'll have my colleague do it.

Japanese: もしこれがバレたらどうしようか
English: What if this gets found out?

Japanese: 僕らこんなに仲良いなんて不思議だね
English: It's funny how close we are.

Japanese: 関西に帰るとしたら少なくとも3年後かな
English: If I were to get back to Kansai, that would be at least 3 years.

Japanese: これってどんな料理ですか？
English: What kind of food is this?

Japanese: レギュラーサイズのコーヒーをください
English: I'll have a regular hot coffee, please.

Japanese: 大金を稼ぐより知識を追い求めたい
English: I want to pursue knowledge rather than make a whole lot of money.

Japanese: 何してんの？って感じだった
English: I was like, "What is he doing."

Japanese: 練習すればするほど、ダンスが楽しくなっていく
English: The more you practice, the more fun dancing becomes.

Japanese: 高いからといった必ずしもオシャレとは限らない
English: Expensive clothes are not necessarily fashionable.

Japanese: 高いからといっていい服とは限らない
English: Just because it's expensive doesn't mean it's good clothing.

Japanese: 何でサッカー始めたの？（使役）
English: What made you start soccer?

Japanese: 京都に6年間住んでた
English: I used to live in Kyoto for 6 years.

Japanese: 全く知らなかった
English: I didn't know that at all.

Japanese: 思ってたより簡単だね
English: It is not as hard as I expected.

Japanese: 普段は1日8時間くらい働いている
English: I usually spend about 8 hours a day working.

Japanese: 英語を話すのに慣れました
English: I'm already used to speaking English.

Japanese: 勉強のことになると
English: When it comes to studying,

Japanese: 歌ってリフレッシュしたい気分
English: I feel like singing to refresh myself.

Japanese: お皿洗いお願いしてもいい？
English: Do you mind doing the dishes?

Japanese: 高校を卒業して10年になる
English: It's been 10 years since I graduated from high school.

Japanese: その時間にラーメン屋さん空いてるかわからない
English: I don't know if the ramen restaurant is open at that time.

Japanese: 将来海外で働くために英語も勉強をしています
English: I'm studying English so that I can work in other country in the future.

Japanese: その日雨降ったらどうしようか
English: What if it rains that day?

Japanese: 彼は6pmから働くことになっている
English: He’s supposed to work from 6pm.

Japanese: 明日返してもらえるとありがたい
English: If you could return it tomorrow, that would be great.

Japanese: 今朝寒すぎて布団から出れなかった
English: It was so cold this morning that I couldn't get out of bed.

Japanese: どれくらい時間かかるわからない
English: I don't know how long it takes.

Japanese: ただ疲れてるだけ
English: It's just that I'm tired.

Japanese: 最近外食する機会がない
English: I don't get to go out to eat recently.

Japanese: 彼が時間通りに来るわけがない
English: There is no way he is coming on time.

Japanese: 多分明日までにはできる
English: I'll probably make it by tomorrow.

Japanese: 久しぶりにジャケット買った
English: I bought a jacket for the first time in ages.

Japanese: だからそれ嫌いなんだよ
English: That's why I really hate it.

Japanese: 多ければ多いほどいい
English: The more, the better.

Japanese: この映画は見る価値あるよ
English: This movie is worth watching.

Japanese: もしそうなったら
English: In which case,

Japanese: 日本人のいいところは謙虚なところ
English: One good thing about Japanese people is their humility.

Japanese: 嫌いって意味じゃなくて
English: It's not that I hate it,

Japanese: あの飲み会やばかったよな!?
English: Do you remember how crazy the drinking party was?
